justification: The Materials section states that participants answered “What is the probability that the defendant committed the crime?” and that, except for the verdict, all judgments were made on a 0–100% scale.
Participants judged blame via the item “How much do you blame the defendant for the crime?” which was scored on a 0–100% scale.
The transcript notes an item asking “How intentional do you think the defendant's actions were?” rated from 0–100%.
Participants rated “To what extent did the defendant commit the crime because he is a bad person,” identified as a dispositional judgment on a 0–100% scale.
A parallel item asked “To what extent did the defendant commit the crime … because of the situation he was in?” providing a situational attribution score on the same 0–100% scale.
The measure list includes “desire to punish (How much do you want to punish the defendant?)” which participants answered on a 0–100% scale.
After testimony, participants rated credibility with the prompt “How much do you believe that the witness is telling the truth?” using the same percentage scale.
Participants also judged “How important was this piece of evidence in making your judgment?” providing an importance score from 0–100%.

measured_by: binary guilty / not guilty verdict question
justification: The list of judgments begins with a “guilty/not guilty verdict,” indicating that the construct of verdict was measured by a forced-choice binary question.
